channel.title: masstransit on Andy Dote
channel.description: Recent content in masstransit on Andy Dote

item.title: Testing RabbitMQ Concurrency in MassTransit
item.description: We have a service which consumes messages from a RabbitMQ queue - for each message, it makes a few http calls, collates the results, does a little processing, and then pushes the results to a 3rd party api. One of the main benefits to having this behind a queue is our usage pattern - the queue usually only has a few messages in it per second, but periodically it will get a million or so messages within 30 minutes (so from ~5 messages/second to ~560 messages/second.
